11131211.title: Anthro Cadence!

111312111.content:
Aleks was calmly walking down the street, hands in his pocket, and his head at an angle. Tonight was generally peaceful, not a sound was heard throughout the night. However, Aleks heard a sound... the clicking of a gun. He felt the cold medal pushed up against his head through his hair. He wanted to look back, to see who the offender was, but feared that they would shoot if he moved.

"Money." A single word escaped the mouth of the thug, it was obvious what they wanted. "Now." The same thug said, sounding a bit impatient.

"Alright, chill." Aleks responded, slowly reaching into his pocket and pulling out his wallet. He then handed it to the thug behind, how snatched it away.

"Now be a good boy, and stand there for me." The thug said as he started rummaging through the wallet, putting the gun down. He thought Aleks would be too scared to move, but Aleks would not put up with this. The young man quickly turned around, throwing a punch directly into the mans jaw. He stumbled, dropping Aleks' wallet. He went for a second punch, but a sudden pain in his stomach stopped him. Looking down, he saw a slowly growing blood stain on his shirt, he had been shot.

"Piece of..." The thug began, but Aleks was already lossing consciousness from loss of blood. Soon enough, he fell to the ground, desperately trying to stop his bleeding. "You're going into the river you disobedient piece of trash." The thug said, lifting him up nd spxhucking him into a nearby river, allowing his body to float downstream.

Aleks just kept floating, the cold water helping the bleeding a tiny bit, but not enough to save him. He had no idea how long he had been floating, but it felt like eternity.

Not far off now was a pink anthromorphic alicorn. Her legs had the joints of a human, but the structure of a pony, her body looked like a human females, she had the arms and hands of a human, and she had the head of a pony. Her mane and tail consisted of violet, rose and pale gold, all coming down in streaks. She was sitting on the beach of an isolated island, staring off into the sky.moutmof the corner of her eye though, she saw a figure floating in the water.

Cadance got to her hooves, looking at what was in the river, and her eyes widened at the sight. She saw a human floating. She called forth her magic, bringing the man out of the water and towards her. Looking him over, he was still alive, but wouldn't be for long. She panicked a little, she needed to save this man, it was the right thing to do. She quickly ran to her home, hoping she could save Aleks.
111312111.title: Growth.

1113121111.content:
Aleks groaned as he regained consciousness, he still felt the dull throbbing of what use to be pain in his stomach. Opening his eyes, he saw that he appeared to be in a cabin of sorts. How he got here, or where he was now we're questions brewing in his mind. He tried pushing himself off the bed he was laying on, letting out a small grunt of pain.

"Oh, you're awake," a female voice called out, seemingly talking to him. Aleks turned, looking towards the direction of the voice, but instead of seeing a human female, what he saw instead was a pink horse creature. Cadance stood at the door of the room, coming in to check on Aleks as he recovered. Once he saw him just staring at her, she let out a small sigh. "You're shocked I'm a talking pony walking on two legs, right?"

"Holy shit..." Aleks said, baffled as to how this creature, now known she, existed. Was she like a Bigfoot, creatures that have been 'sighted' but never actually seen, or was he just vividly hallucinating do to blood loss (which was unlikely).

"I'll take that as a yes," Cadance said, "and no, I'm not just some imaginary creature you made up," she said as she took a seat at a nearby chair. "Please be careful, I'm not a medic or docter by any means, so I don't know how well the bandages will hold up. But I did do a good job if I saw so myself," Cadance looked at the silent Aleks, "You can respond, sir," she said, Aleks shook his head, being addressed by her.

"Oh, um, thanks for helping me," he quickly said, I bit to fast for his own liking. "Uh, can I ask something real quick?" He asked, not off the bed and standing.

"Of course," Cadance responded.

"WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON?!" Aleks yelled, shocking Cadance.

"Okay... not the question I was expecting, but reasonable I guess..." She began "Well, I had found you floating down the river with a horrible wound, so I brought you in and nursed you back to health, the best I can," Cadence said, "Oh, I forgot to introduce myself. My name is Cadance, as you can most likely tell, I'm not... native here. What is your name?"

"Aleks... Uh, what exactly are you? You said a pony right?"

"Correct."

"But... You look-"

"Nothing like the ponies here on earth?" Cadance finished Aleks' sentence, gaining a nod from him. "Well, I'm not from earth, obviously. I am from a land called Equestria, which is on a planet called... actually, now that I think about it, I don't think we ever named our planet. Point is, I'm not from earth," Cadance summed up.

"Okay, why are you here then?"

"That's the thing, I'm not entirely sure how I got here. One day, I'm tucked into bed, the next morning I find myself here on this island. I've been here for a few weeks now, about three maybe. I had to build this cabin and collect food and usable water, it was difficult, but as you can see, I've managed."

"Wait, you built this in three weeks, by yourself?"

"Yes, I did. That reminds me, I never showed you," Cadance began, standing up from her seat, "I was able to get this done because I have this ability," at this, Cadance's horn, that Aleks only now noticed, lit up as a pair of curtains opened up, allowing the moonlight in.

"What the, how did you..." Aleks questioned, though he never finished his sentence.

"I am an alicorn, I have unicorn magic, and," she unfolding wings Aleks didn't know she had, "pegasus wings. As well as the strength and endurance of an earth pony. It was all these factors that helped me survive here."

"Wings, you can fly, right? Then why don't you leave this island?" Aleks asked.

"I can, but I heard most humans aren't the nicest when it comes to strange creatures," at this, Aleks realized that his question was a bit stupid to ask.

"Right..."

"But, if you want me too, I can fly you back to civilization," she offered. Aleks considered it for a moment.

"Do you have anyone else here?"

"... No, I've just been here by myself, your the only being I've talked to in three weeks," Cadance responded, here ears drooping a bit, realizing that after he's gone, she would be alone again. Aleks saw this, and considered his options.

"You know what Cadance, I'll stay here with you," he said, putting on a smile.

"What? But... what about your friends, and your family?"

"I don't have that good relationship with my family, and my friends will just have live without me. I'm too nice to leave you alone here," at this, Cadance began to tear up a bit, the human was willing to sacrifice his normal life to make sure she wasn't alone. Being caught up in the moment, Cadance ran over to him, enveloping him in a hug.

"Thank you so much Aleks, you have no idea how much this means to me," she said, tears gently falling down her face. After recovering from suddenly being hugged, Aleks wrapped an arm around her, feeling the silky smooth fur of hers (she didn't wear clothes, since her fur acted as her clothing). In this moment, Aleks saw how tall she was. About 5'8", just four inches shorter than him, though unbeknownst to both of them, that would last long.

11211.content:
"This sucks."

Axel kicked a stray piece of crumpled paper out of his way as he walked through the city streets.

"If there's a God, he hates me."

He had just lost his job, his car had been stolen, and he lived over twenty miles away. With no cell phone to call anyone, he was stuck walking back to his house. It was already eight o'clock, and he had school the next morning. His mind wandered a fair bit as he continued, keeping his hands in his jacket pockets to ward off the cold fall air. Another chill breeze ruffled his combed-back dark brown hair, and penetrated his jacket and the Hawaiian shirt he wore beneath. His sapphire eyes were downcast, staring intently at the pavement. In his own misery, he didn't even notice someone walk out of an alley and begin following him.

That one person was soon joined by a second, and then a third, all the while eluding Axel's notice. As Axel approached the bridge that led out of the city towards his hometown, a fourth man stepped out of the forest area off to the side of the road, and stopped him from the front.

"Hey, kid," The first man who was tailing him said, "Hand over your wallet and turn out your pockets. Do as we say, and you won't get hurt. Much."
11211.title: Not a good day

choices: You wake up with her still on top of her
Rena's making a soup of some kind (please don't say she's gonna eat him)
112111.content:
(switching from 3rd to 2nd person)

You can't believe what was happening, "worst day ever" you think. You pull out you're wallet as it didn't have much and throw it to the guy who asked as well as you're useless car keys, he looks through the wallet and says "hey kid what's you're card number?" You tell him and he smiles "thanks kid, well come on guys there's no way this coward will call the cops so let's just leave him alone" he says before turning around and he follows with his partners following. You just stand there stunned "Ok so i've lost my job, my car, I just got mugged, this day totally sucks" you think starting to walk across the bridge. You make it about half way when you hear a car horn and you jump to the side seeing a car race past you, problem was this was a footbridge. You let out a sigh as you fall over the side and plunge into the river below. You try to swim but the current was too strong, you keep fighting as you didn't want to die yet but you slowly lose strength and eventually you just give up. You feel like you're lungs are on fire and you black out sure that you were gonna die.

You wake up for a bit and you feel yourself being dragged out of the river, "are you okay?" you hear a female voice ask. You're just able to moan a bit indicating you were alive but not in good shape before you black out again. You wake up again afraid out of you're mind, you look around and you're in a giant cave big enough to hold something like 20 bears and them some with room to spare during the winter months. You notice a large fire in the middle of the cave and you look around for the person that saved you. You can't see anyone but you're covered in a large yellow and white blanket, you figure it had to be 8 times you're size so 40ft long, it was a weird blanket, it looked like it was some kind of bi pedal fox and part of it was covererd in purple, and it felt like there was a pair of arms around you're back. This weird blanket even seemed to have a tail, "I really hope this isn't some weird dead animal" you think. You try to get up but the "blanket" covering you was too heavy and you swear it felt like when you moved it moved with you and the arms got tighter. "Hello" you yell trying to get the attention of that female that had saved you, you hear movement and you look around that's when you realize the movement was nearby. You look down and you're shocked as you see the tail on the blanket twitch from side to side.

"Ahh" you scream and you try to push you're way away from this creature that was on top of you. It holds you even tighter and pulls you closer rubbing the part that had been right next to you're head which you realize was it's head against you. "Ok there's got to be a way out of this" you think frantically, you reach over and rub it's side and much to you're suprise the creature lets out a giggle. You rub some more till it's gently laughing and you're able to free yourself, you run over to the fire and grab one of the sticks out of the fire hoping you can use it to hold this thing back. It stirs and stretches then looks at where you're supposed to be and you see worry spread over it's face, it looks around and when it notices you it smiles and gets up. You were right it stood 40ft tall and now that it was standing up you recognized what it was but that was impossible. It was a renamon from that digimon show you watched when you were younger but those were supposed to be fiction. It steps forward and you hold the burning stick in front of you "stay....stay back" you say but the renamon advances. You swing the branch and she easily dodges it and knocks it out of you're hands back onto the fire.

She bends down and stares at you eye to eye "don't worry little one i'm not going to hurt you" she says.

Recognizing the voice you say "wait, you're the one that saved me"

"Yes, I found you in the river, you weren't doing very well so I brought you home and took care of you" she giggles for a second "you wouldn't let go of my fur the whole time I was watching over you so I had to carry you around" she says.

"But...but that's impossible you're supposed to be fiction" you say. She reaches over and gently pokes you with 1 finger, "does this feel like fiction?" she asks.

"Well no, but why'd you save me?" you ask.

"Well I can't just leave someone to die, besides it's nice to finally have some company" she replies.

"I'm Axel" you say hesitantly reaching out a hand.

"I'm,....you know I don't think I have a name" the renamon says.

"How about Rena?" you ask starting to settle down.

"That sounds cute, i'll take it" Rena says. "Well you'll probably want to be leaving now" Rena continues.

"I think I can stay, I mean what kind of gratitude is it to just leave the girl who saved me" you say.

"Don't you have a family to get back to?" Rena asks.

"Nah I haven't spoken to my family in ages after I said I needed to spread my wings, no girlfriend, and no job so it's not like anyone's gonna come looking for me" you say. "So I can stay with you if you really need some company" you say. Rena pounces on top of you and she has a smile on her face "oh thank, thank you, it's been so lonely" she says before nuzzling you.

"So how'd you get here?" you ask.

"You know I don't know, I just remember being here with my mother and it's all i've really known" Rena says.

"Is you're mother still around?" you ask looking around.

"No, she passed a while back" Rena says.

"I'm sorry for bringing it up" you say.

"No it's ok, I have you now to keep me company" Rena says before hugging you.

"You're a very affectionate renamon" you say as she hugs you.

"Well why wouldn't I be, you're just so cute, and you were constantly trying to bury yourself into my fur before so you must like me" she says smiling. Well you had to admit she looked very cute and she did take care of you.

"Is there any food around here?" you ask.

"Oh you're hungry, well then just let me go get something for you" Rena says putting you down and running out of the cave.

"Well this isn't how I expected today to go but it could be a heck of a lot worse, warm place to stay, food and drink, and I get a giant renamon as a companion yeah this could be a lot worse" you think as you lay back. Rena comes back in a second carrying a bunch of berries, she bends down and offers you one "open up" she says.

"I can feed myself" you say sitting up and reaching for the berry but she pulls back.

"You're in my house you will follow my rules" Rena says smiling "now open up or no food." You let her feed you the berries and she smiles the whole time, "so Axel can you tell me about yourself?" Rena asks.

"There's not that much to tell, I'm just a normal guy, who got mugged today and accidentally jumped off a bridge" you say laughing a little.

"You poor thing" Rena says pulling you to her and holding you against her chest. "Don't worry i'll take care of you from now on" she says.

"I can take care of myself" you say.

"Oh hush, you don't like my hospitality?" Rena asks staring at you eye to eye and you can see the loneliness she's suffered reflected in her eyes.

"No I guess being taken care of by you wouldn't be so bad" you say hugging her. You feel one of her paws rub over you're back and you snuggle yourself into her fur. Rena gets up making sure to lift you with her, she walks over to the area you woke up on which you realize now was a bed of leaves and twigs. Rena puts you down and then slowly lays on top of you making sure not to hurt you, "Good night Axel" she says.

"Good night Rena" you say honestly happy that the events of today had happened.
112111.title: Cooperate

1121111.content:
You wake up slowly with Rena still laying slightly on top of you. You try to wiggle out so you can go to the bathroom but Rena just rolls over and hugs you close to her. She starts mumbling "glad.....company.....not alone anymore" causing you to smile. You're just able to wiggle yourself out and you head outside the cave to do you're buisness. You re-enter the cave once you're finished and you find Rena still asleep. You lay down next to her and just watch her sleep for a bit "she's actually pretty cute" you think as she rolls over so she's on her side facing you now. You move closer and you stroke her back "wow she's so soft" you think. You keep stroking until Rena wakes up and she looks at you with that piercing stare.

"Um......good morning" you say not sure if you upset her.

"Good morning" Rena says as a smile breaks out on her face, "can you do that again that felt really good" Rena says.

"Sure" you say, you walk behind Rena and start gently stroking her back and she lays back down on the bed. You sit there and stroke her for a good 10 minutes before Rena sits up and smiles at you. "Thanks Axel that felt soo good" Rena says.

"No problem it's the least I can do for saving me" you say. Rena wraps her arms around you and pulls you close to her. She gently rubs you're back and starts humming. "So Axel what do you think of me as a blanket?" Rena asks.

"Well that's a weird question but you're really comfy, warm. and fuzzy" you say.

"Thanks Axel, i'm glad to hear that" Rena says pulling you back and smiling a bit.

"Ugh i'm hungry" you say.

"Oh let me get some more berries" Rena says getting up and running out of the cave. You run out after her wanting to find out where Rena found these berries. You follow her through a bunch of trees, bushes, and even over a small stream until she enters a clearing full of bushes. You walk up to one of the bushes and they're full of berries, Rena enters the centre of the clearing and much to you're suprise she starts glowing. You hide behind one of the bushes as Rena transforms or well digivolves into Kyubimon. She lets out a bunch of ghost fire that surrounds the area. You slowly step out from behind the bush and Rena or should I say Kyubimon turns and stares at you.

"Hey I didn't know you could digivolve" you say walking up but you stop as Kyubi-Rena snarls at you. She pounces toward you and knocks you over easily as she was now atleast 100ft tall as her face was bigger then you were. You try to back up but she blocks you're path with her paws and stares down intently at you. "Rena are you ok?" you ask as she wasn't doing anything. She leans her head down and licks you once with her tongue, she gently breathes on you for a bit washing over you with her warm breath. She opens her mouth wide and lowers her head toward you, "Waitttt" you yell prompting her to stop right above you. KyubiRena raises her head and stares at you confused, more becuase she stopped then you yelling. She looks down at you a second time and sniffs you this time, she pushes you with her muzzle now somewhat confused that she didn't just eat you. You sit up and gently stroke her muzzle somewhat assure that she won't eat you. KyubiRena lays down so that one of her paws is over top of you and she starts glowing again, you shut you're eyes once she started glowing as it was such a bright light. When you open them you find Rena laying there, she opens her eyes and is shocked to see you there.

"Axel what are you doing here? are you ok? did you see it?" Rena asks.

"I followed you to find out where you got the berries from, i'm alright and I saw you become Kyuubimon not only that but you well tried to eat me" you say answering each of her questions in turn. She hugs you tightly "I'm so sorry" she says "whenever I become Kyuubimon I go kind of feral that's why I seal myself with the ghost fire" Rena says.

"It's ok it's not like i'm hurt or anything" you say.

"Yeah but...but you'd be dead and I would of been the one who killed you" Rena says starting to cry.

"Hey hey it's nothing to cr...mmphh" you're cut off as Rena kisses you. You're shocked for a second as you could tell the feeling behind the kiss as Rena hugged you tightly when she kissed you. You feel her lips quiver as you weren't returning it so you gently kiss her back, you feel her whole body quiver and she totally lets go pushing you over and laying on top of. She kisses you again and again for a good minute before getting up, "i'm....i'm sorry, i'm not sure what came over me I just....I just don't want to be alone again" Rena says starting to cry again. She hides her face and turns so you can't see but you can easily see her body shaking. You walk up and look around her "her Rena, you did stop yourself you know, it's the reason i'm not hurt" you say. She just turns away and you sigh. You walk around her so you're standing in front of her and you grab each of her arms with a hand. You slowly part them suprised she wasn't putting up any resistance. She stares at you through teary eyes and you slowly move forward and wrap you're arms around her neck before kissing her. She just stares at you shocked before kissing back, you break the kiss after half a minute passes and you smile at her, "Rena you saved me so I owe you my life, so it's ok if you took it" you say smiling. Rena shakes her head and she hugs you tightly "I don't want you to die" she says.

"Fine then I won't" you reply. Rena stares at you and she starts crying again. "Hey hey, stop that" you say brushing a few tears aside "I don't ever want to see you cry, because if you're sad that'll make me sad too" you say prompting her to hug you again. "Can we have some berries now i'm still kind of hungry" you say.

"Sure" Rena says she pushes you back so you land on you're butt "wait there" Rena says as she zips around the clearing picking berries. She returns in a few minutes and offers you a berry "open up" she says. You sigh and let her feed you, however you notice she's smiling the whole time. She feeds you every berry by hand up till the last one that looked different, all the others berries were blue or black but this one was red. Rena picks this one up and stares at it for a bit before placing it halfway in her mouth. She leans over and wait expectantly. "No, no way am I doing that" you say. Rena's ears droop and you see her eyes quiver for a second, "Oh fine" you say eating the berry and kissing her in the process.

"Yay" Rena says tackling you and hugging you after the berry's gone, "now come Axel it's time we went home" Rena says picking you up and running back to the cave. She puts you down and walks further into the cave a noticeable spring in her step. Rena turns around and runs up to you, she pushes you over and cuddles up next to you. "Axel you'll never leave right?" Rena asks. "You should of asked that sooner but no Rena i'll never leave since you're so kind" you say rubbing her back.

"That's good" Rena says as she lays her head down covering you're whole lap.

"Sleepy?" you ask.

"No I just want to be near you" Rena says happily. You smile at her words and you start stroking her back.

"Hey Rena do you mind if I go use the river to wash off" you say.

"Not without me" she says lifting her head up.
1121111.title: You wake up with her still on top of her

choices: Rena doesn't get up and she teases you a bit
Rena gets up but decides to play a trick on you
11211111.content:
"I don't think that's necessary" you say.

"You're not leaving unless I come" Rena says.

"Oh come on i'm not going to leave" you say but Rena stands firm. After a few minutes you sigh "fine you can come" you say and she smiled at you. She stoop up and you followed her to the river, you tentativley stuck you're foot in when you reached it and much to you're surpise it was somewhat warm, "it's midday, so the sun's been shining on it for a while" Rena says. You start taking you're shirt off and stop as you realize Rena is watching you, "I kind of need you to turn around" you say. She does so but you were sure you saw her peek over her shoulder atleast once. You stepped into the stream and thankfully the current was barely non existant here, you swam around for a bit before you heard a splash and Rena swims up to you. "Rena what are you doing" you ask turning and heading for the shore, she swims up next to you "not much I just wanted to swim too" she says. You crawl onto the shore making sure to cover yourself and you lay down in the grass. Rena walks out and shakes herself before sitting down in the grass, "what are you doing?" she asks.

"Letting the sun dry me" you reply.

"You'll catch a cold like that" she says.

"No I won't it's summer" you reply, Rena leans down and hugs you, you jump backwards. "What's wrong?" she asks.

"You're still wet" you say, she just shrugs off you're answer and moves toward you "so, this way we'll both get warmer faster" she says but she has a weird look in her eyes. "Besides you don't seem to mind" she comments. You weren't sure what she meant until she pointed down, you look to see that not only were you facing her fully nude but you were as large as you could have been. "Ahhh" you yell and cover yourself, running over to you're clothes, thankfully the sun had dried you enough so that when you put you're clothes on none got wet. Rena walks up giggling, "what's wrong?" she asks.

"Aren't you embarassed, since you just saw me naked?" you ask.

"No, you see me nude everyday" she replies.

"What are you talking about, there's a patch of fur over you're breasts and vagina, that's not naked to me" you say. "Besides you well saw me when I was well..." you trail off. Rena smiles and lifts you up into a hug "it's ok, I know that just means you find me attractive, i'm flattered" she says. You couldn't look her straight in the face you were blushing too much, Rena giggles again and gently nuzzles you "Axel don't worry, I don't mind it, in fact I like you like that too" she says. You turn and stare at her shocked "what? I can't find you attractive? silly boy" she says smiling. She taps you on the nose and giggles again, "well come on let's head back, we could be seen out here" she says opting to carry you instead of putting you down and letting you follow her. You reach the cave and much to you're suprise you shiver in Rena's arms, "I told you you'd catch cold" she says putting you down. She runs to the back of the cave and looks around for a bit before looking behind a rock. She comes back carrying a bunch of sticks and soon has a fire going. She pushes you closer to it before laying behind you. You hold you're hands out to get them warmed up and Rena pulled you back, Rena nestles you against her stomach and not really having any reason to reject her invitation you get comfy and lay back. You looked over to see her smiling at you, and she lays her head down very much content and secure. You laid you're head back and you were soon asleep as when you next opened you're eyes the fire was out. You looked over to see Rena asleep, although it was clearly still daytime as the sun was shining brightly into the cave. You stretch and walk outside a bit, that's when you hear it. It sounded like breathing, and you hear a twig snap, you duck behind the cave wall and much to you're suprise you see a brown bear walk out of the trees and it heads straight for Rena's cave.

You run back inside and start shaking Rena "wake up, wake up" you say. She opens her eyes and smiles at you "morning "yawn" Axel" she replies.

"It's not morning and we kind of have a problem" you say turning as part of the light was blocked out as the bear enters. Rena turns and stares at the bear and it snarls at the both of you raising itself up to about 8ft tall. Rena however stands up and totally dwarfs the bear, the bear unfazed however charges forward. Rena just smiles and you see blue flame start to surround her fist. Just before the bear's on top of her she punches it square in the face. The bear is thrown backwards like it got hit by a truck, it turns and stares at Rena before quickly retreating out the way it came. You stand there shocked and Rena turns and smiles at you "was that the problem?" she asks casually.

"Uh...yeah it was" you reply.

"Well it's taken care of" she says.

"Wow, remind me never to get on you're bad side ok" you say still shocked at what you just saw.

"You won't" Rena says confidently, she lays down and her tail moves from side to side for a bit "hey axel you mind stroking my back?" Rena asks.

"Sure" you reply, you walk over and start stroking her and Rena sighs, you looked her over as you stroked her and the longer you had to examine her the fewer and fewer flaws you found in her. Rena finally turns after about 5 minutes and you had started imagining things so you weren't really paying attention.

"Axel, you sure are bold" Rena says, you stop and look down to see you're hand was right over her nether regions, without the fur well you were glad it was there.

"Oh crap, i'm sorry" you say backing up, Rena sits up and smiles at you "it's alright, what distracted you so much?" she asks.

"Well I was thinking about how flawless you are" you say.

"Oh stop, i'm not flawless" she replies blushing a bit.

"But you are, you're smart, athletic, beautiful, kind I can't find a fault" you say seriously.

"Really?" Rena asks.

"Yeah, and i'm just plain old me" you say sighing a bit. Rena stares at you with those peircing eyes and you saw them soften. Rena gets up and stares at you "so you're just you are you?" she says. You nod and she sighs, she walks around you and picks you up depositing you on the bed of leaves and twigs. She lays over you holding herself up a bit and smiles down at you, "you're not just you, you're mine now and that makes you special" Rena says. You sigh and you're about to sigh again when Rena seals it in you're throat by kissing you "stop being all depressed, you're a nice guy, and you were kind enough to stay with a weirdo like me" Rena says.

"You're not a weirdo you're a beautiful fox woman and anyone who says otherwise is just wrong" you reply quickly. Rena smiles again before gently falling over top of you. "Thank you Axel, that's the nicest thing anyone's ever said to me" Rena says wrapping her arms around you.

"No problem, but ah can you kind of get up" you ask.

"Why?" Rena asks.

"Well i'm kind of embarrassed" you say.
11211111.title: Object

112111111.content:
Rena smiles down at you, "oh you are?" she asks pushing herself down and pushing her chest down near engulfing you're torso.

"Rena get off" you say trying to push her back but she deftly grabs you're hands and pins them to you're side before wrapping her arms around you. "So how many kids do you want Axel?" Rena says sitting up pinning you're arms with her legs, "i've always wanted a lot, more to love" she says. You don't answer and she seems to pout, "aww Axel do you not like me enough for that?" she says.

"No, I mean yes I like you enough, i'd love to be you're mate" you say looking away, when you look back at Rena she had a huge smile on her face. "Geez Axel I was just kidding" she says, "I wasn't" you reply. Rena looks down at you shocked, "Axel....you'd really want me?" she asks.

"Of course Rena" you reply, by now her legs had relaxed and you sat up hugging her lower body, "Rena I want no other then you, i'll admit when I first saw you I was scared of you, but now, well you've taken such good care of me and well I love you" you say. Rena looks down at you shocked, "no Axel you can't" she says pushing you back.

"Why?" you ask suprised.

"The last person who loved me died because of me" Rena says.

"Rena that just showed how much they cared" you say but Rena shakes her head "Rena i'd die for you" you say. You seem to have said the wrong thing as she lets out a roar and tackles you, "don't...don't..ever..say..that" she breaks down and lowers her head down next to yours. You stroke her and after a few seconds she brings herself up, "the last one who loved me, was my mother" she says not able to make eye contact, "and she did die for me, she died so I could get away to here and it wasn't years ago, it was a few months ago" Rena says looking at you. You looked up at Rena shocked, she looks away and steps off, "i'm sorry Axel, i've kept you here for my own purposes" she says. She's so suprised that you tackled her that you were able to bowl her over, you both rolled once and you ended up sitting on her chest, you looked down at her and hugged her as tightly as you could "Rena, i'm sorry you had to go through that" you say pretty much crying yourself. Rena wraps her arms around you tightly and snuggled her head into you're shoulder and lets loose, you spent the next few minutes gently stroking her back and telling her it would be ok as she cried her heart out. Finally the tears subsided and Rena looked up at you "i'm sorry Axe,,,," you didn't let her finish, kissing her with all you're mouth you explored her mouth with you're tongue. Rena actually seemed to get impatient and pushed you're tongue back with hers, exploring you're mouth was a lot easier as her tongue pretty much filled you're mouth. Finally after a few seconds Rena broke the kiss and looked up at you "Axel.." she starts.

"Shh Rena just enjoy the moment" you say.

She shakes her head, "Axel I need to tell you something" she says.

"Please don't let it be something else sad, because then i'm never gonna stop hugging you" you reply smiling at her. Rena grins, "no it isn't" and you let out a small cry as she flips you both over so that she was sitting on you're legs again, "I just thought you'd like to know I feel the same" she says. You smiled up at her, "well that's great news, so um.... any other things you should tell me, like um what happened to you and you're mother?" you ask.

Rena sighs and climbs off sitting down, "me and my mother were brought here by you're kind expirimenting with transdimensional technology, you are right in considering us fiction as we could probably conquer you're world in a day if we invaded full force. Anyways the scientists held us captive for a year testing us, probing us, but never once trying to befriend us, like you had Axel" she stops for a second to give you a quick hug. "Anyways, my mother was thrice my size yet they somehow kept her restrained finally she broke free from her restraints and transformed into kyubimon, if you thought I was large she was atleast 300ft in her form" Rena says. She looks away " my mother proceeded to ravage the facility and when all was over I was left standing on a pile of rubble and my mother was nowhere to be seen" she says. "What was the research facilities name?" you ask.

"Blue bay research" she replies.

You freeze, that was the research facility right on the edge of town, you read the story of it getting demolished in the paper, There were over 100 people killed in the destruction of the facility, you looked over at Rena, "hey Rena you'd never do something like that?" you ask. Rena looks at you like she read you're mind, "Axel I was surrounded by bodies even though they were a lot smaller, so no I wouldn't" Rena says. You nod, "sorry if that seems accusatory" you say.

"It's alright" Rena says cuddling you, "I just wish I could see my mother again" she says. You froze as suddenly the sky seemed to darken like the sun was blotted out, you tapped Rena and she turned and sniffed the air, you saw something in her eyes before she shook her head. You looked at Rena and she looked relived but also scared, "Rena what's wrong?" you ask as she kept looking at the mouth of the cave that was till darkened. "I...I swear I can smell my mother's scent" she says looking at you. Throwing caution to the wind you threw caution to the wind and ran to the mouth of the cave and froze when you got outside. Standing there blotting out the sun was Rena's twin, except a lot larger, you just stood there staring up and up and up open mouthed. The figure turns and notices you, "oh hello" she says leaning toward you, you quickly realized there was only one being this could be. "Hey...uh Rena you might want to come out here?" you yell.

"No, for some reason I swear I can smell my mother, it's torture" she yells back.

"For the love of all that's good in the world get you're ass out here" you yell back into the cave. Rena finally walks out and freezes staring at the figure way above her.

"Hello my little kit, you've grown since I saw you last" Rena's mother says. Without hesitation Rena runs forward and leaps like an athlete landing in her mother's waiting arms. You just sat back and watched as mother and daughter embraced. Rena's mother turns and stares at you growling a bit "so who are you" she asks angrily.

"Axel, at you're service ma'am" you say bowing. She's actually taken aback, "Rena?" she asks.

"Relax mom, I saved him from drowning he's a good human" Rena says. "Axel i'd like you to meet Kiera my mother" Rena says.

"My pleasure" you say.

Kiera smiles, "well if you've befriended my daughter, you can't be all bad" she says.

"Thanks, you don't seem to be that bad, for a 120ft tall renamom" you reply.

"Little one why does he call you Rena?" Kiera asks.

"Well, he gave me the name, and just a few minutes ago he offered to be my mate" Rena continued.

Kiera stares down at you suprised, she nods, "well this is an interesting turn of events." she says.

She lowers her face toward you and you knew she could eat you in one gulp. "Mom don't hurt him" Rena yells.

Kiera much to both you're suprise laughs "I wouldn't dream of it, you obviously seem to enjoy being with this man, although I hope he knows what will come with being you're mate" she replies.

"What do you mean?" you ask.

"Oh, well when you 2 go at it, Rena will become my size" Kiera says. You stood there stunned and....
112111111.title: Rena doesn't get up and she teases you a bit

choices: There is a stream with giant fish
1121111112.content:
"So what's the big deal about that?" you ask.

"Y...you're not scared?" Keira replies lowering her head again looking very confused.

"Will she still be the same Rena?" you ask.

"Of course, she'll just be my size" Keira says.

"So then what's the problem, just more Rena for me to love" you reply.

"You probably just want me to have a bigger chest" Rena says smiling at you.

"Well....that's part of it" you reply. Rena laughs and lifts you up "Axel you little perv" she says.

"Sorry Rena but you're just so beautiful, and more of you has to be better" you reply. Rena grins "well then Axel let's get to it" she says.

"Wait get to what?" you reply.

"The fun" Rena replies, she turns to her mother "so does it happen all at once?" she asks.

"As soon as you both finish" Keira replies. Rena nods and starts walking off still holding you "so Axel, how many kits do you think is enough?" she asks.

"W-what? I don't know you said you wanted a lot" you reply staring up at her.

Rena nods and her pace quickens "well then you're gonna have to give me all you got" she says her pace becoming a full on sprint. She bursts into the clearing where those berry bushes were and as she walks to the center "this should be big enough" she says putting you down on the grass. One of her paws firmly pushes you back into the grass before she starts to undress you.

"R-Rena isn't this taking things a bit too fast?" you ask.

Rena stops for a second before continuing "Axel you said you wanted to be my mate, well I want to be yours, I want your kits" she says stripping you of your underwear. She smiles down at you warmly and gently, "don't worry Axel I promise i'll be as gentle as I can" she says her massive body hovering over yours. You slowly nod and Rena gently smiles and lowers herself starting.

For the next half hour all you knew was the gentleness of Rena's touch as she stroked and hugged your body. The warmth of her depths as you gave yourself up to her and she gave herself to you. The softness of her fur as she gently lowered herself on you or hugged you tightly, her warm breath washing over you. You learned just how much she could control you, how soft she was and every curve of her body. Finally you lay on top of Rena's body fully spent as she pretty much purrs underneath you, her warm chest surrounding you in the afterglow.

"Axel that was amazing, I love you so much" she says her arms wrapping around you.

"I love you too Rena" you reply. Suddenly you feel something hit you, it was like you wanted to sleep but you knew it was unnatural, you weren't able to fight it and blacked out. When you woke up your head was still on warm soft fur, you raised your head and froze at what you saw. Rena had grown during your sleep, as her mother said she was now atleast her size of 120ft tall, Rena was probably 125. Rena yawns and stretches and she looks around lazily then more worried "Axel, Axel where are you" she says turning left and right pushing her chest which had grown on it's own inflating atleast one cup size into you over and over.

"Rena down here" you shout up at her, she freezes and looks down at her chest her fear quickly turning to calm as she saw you between her now quite large chest. "Hello my little love" she says smiling at you.

"Hey Rena, I was right you're still beautiful at this size" you say sitting up between her small hills. Rena giggles "you look so cute Axel" she says putting a hand under her chest she sits up and you fall onto her palm. She lifts you up and kisses your whole front "such a cutie" she says. She smiles at you slyly and her tongue darts out and licks you.

"Hey" you say but she licks you again, and again and again until you were soaked.

"Blech what was that?" you ask her wiping saliva off yourself.

"I never really got to taste you, it's one of the ways foxes tell their mate" Ren says smiling, "plus you taste kind of good" she says.

"Ok Rena that's kind of creepy" you reply.

Rena's ears press back against her head "sorry Axel, we really should go find my mother now" she says. You can't help but nod and Rena holds you to her chest for a second ""don't worry Axel i'll make sure nothing happens to you" she says.

You nod "I know you will Rena" you reply. Rena starts walking back to her cave and she reaches it in only a few seconds, she looks around and it was kind of easy to tell where Keira went as she left a trail of overturned trees in her wake. The cave however was a lot further away then we expected taking us an hour to reach it. Rena looks around, "hey I can't see mom" she says, you looked around when suddenly Keira pops out of a solid rock. You both just stare at her "how did you do that?" you ask.

Keira smiles at you "oh come now, you don't think we don't have some illusionary magic?" she says staring at you.

"Uh....no?" you reply. Keira giggles and walks back through the rock, Rena follows her and you were shocked at what was inside. The absolutely massive cavern had a covering of leaves over the whole floor, in 2 places were 2 beds of soft grass although one was clearly made not long ago. Keira smiles at the 2 of us "I'm glad to see that your mating went well" she says.

Rena smiles at her mother "thanks mom" she says. Keria looks at Rena "so how was he?" she asks. "Mom!!" Rena shouts at her mother.

"I'm not going to steal him, I'm just curious if your first time went well" Keira replies suprisingly calm as you and Rena were both red as a tomato.

"It went fine thank you" Rena says moving over to one of the 2 grass beds, she lays out and places you down near her. "Aww Axel I can't cuddle with you like I could before" she says staring down at you. You look up at her "oh I'm sure we can come up with something" you reply smiling. Rena smiles at you mischeviously "your right" she says lifting you up between 2 fingers. She puts you down on her stomach "hey Axel could you, rub my tummy?" she asks.

"Sure Rena" you reply. You reach down and start stroking the soft fur underneath you, you felt Rena's body instantly relax and she sighs "Axel that feels so good" she says. You smiled a bit "I'm glad your enjoying yourself Rena, you deserve a little pampering every now and again" you say Rena moaning a bit as you hit a sweet spot.

"But I don't "oooh" do anything" Rena replies.

"Of course you do, you took care of me, you gave me a bed and a home, Rena I love you, something like this is the least I can do to repay you" you say. Suprisingly you felt Rena' hand wrap around you and you were pulled up to her face "Axel you don't owe me anything, I love you too and your love is all I need, although something like that tummy rub every now and again would be nice" she says. You nod and you heard a cough both of you turning to see Keira standing there the 2 of you totally forgetting about her. "I'm sorry to interrupt you 2 but we should go get some dinner" Keira says.

"Dinner, that's right how do you eat at this size?" you ask.
1121111112.title: You don't lose it

112112.content:
"Okay, fine," Axel said, slowly removing his wallet from the depths of his pocket. He dropped it on the ground and took a few steps back.

The thug who had done the talking moved in to pick it up, but just as he had his hand on it, Axel was right in front of him, his knee slamming into the thug's head. The thief went sprawling, but before he was down and out, his three companions were all over Axel, beating him senseless.

Less than five minutes of brutal violence later, Axel was unconscious and heavily bruised, and a few knife wounds were bleeding openly.

"What do you want to do with this punk, boss?" One of the muggers asked.

"Toss him into the river," The man that Axel had initially hit said.

The group lifted Axel together and tossed him over the edge, listening with satisfaction to a loud splash, and watching victoriously as he drifted downstream.

Axel didn't go more than half a mile before he washed up on a bank, some of his cuts still submerged in water. The cold water partially revived him, and as he stared vacantly to one side, he noticed a large, blurry yellow shape less than fifty yards away.

Renamon was getting a drink by the water's edge, as was her habit after a decent evening meal. But as she tasted the water, she noted a peculiar, coppery taste to it, subtle, but present none the less. She lifted her head, and sniffed the air slightly, finding a similar scent hanging about, but less diluted than the taste in the water. Following her nose, she looked over and saw something vaguely familiar lying next to the water. She moved over quickly to investigate.
112112.title: ...Or not.

1121121.content:
Axel watched the unclear form move over to him quickly, all the while his vision growing more and more unfocused. Whatever it was that was in front of him lifted him carefully, avoiding as best it could touching any of the more serious wounds. Axel slowly slipped away as blood loss began to take hold.

Renamon observed the creature's lack of response with immediate concern. There were growing dark red spots on the cloth on its skin, and its breathing was growing faint. She quickly picked it up, a fairly easy task considering it was only about a quarter of her size. It was groaning in pain quietly as she moved, which only convinced her to pick up her pace to go home.
1121121.title: ...but not for long.

choices: Well? Answer her. She asked you a question.
At a bit of a loss for words.
11211211.content:
Axel woke up uncomfortably warm. He tried moving, only to be stopped by an immense pain in his arm. He examined the crude splint on it, surmising that his arm was most likely broken, to which he expressed three words:

"God damn it."

He looked around to get a bearing on his surroundings, and noted that he was in a sparingly lit cave, well furnished for something roughly four times his size. Over by a one of the walls was a large lake that stretched on for a rather remarkable distance. He watched in detached fascination as something moved towards where he was. As it broke the surface, he noted it looked like a giant yellow fox standing on its hind legs. It's midnight blue eyes focused on him as it advanced. By his own estimates, Axel guessed it was roughly twenty-some feet tall. He stood up to quickly run away, but before he had taken a single step, the creature pounced on him, holding him in place. Axel decided against squirming out of fear that that might only encourage it.

"Please try not to move too much. You might tear open some of your wounds."

Axel stared in partial disbelief. Something that could easily use him as lunch was speaking to him.

"Am I using the correct language? I think humans around here speak English, but I'm not certain. If you can understand me, please, tell me your name." Renamon said while Axel stared at her like an idiot.
11211211.title: That night...

choices: Might as well have a bath now.
112112112.content:
Axel was too busy trying to process what was going on to notice Renamon talking to him.

"Hello? Anybody there?" Renamon asked curiously, waving a hand in front of Axel's face.

Axel blinked, glanced over at her, and said, "Axel. My name is Axel Lombard."

Renamon let him go, and as he took a step back, said, "I wasn't joking when I said you shouldn't move much."

"Where are my shirt and jacket?" Axel asked, looking around. "I know those things don't just magically disappear."

Renamon pointed over towards the fire by the wall opposite to the lake. As Axel began to move, Renamon quickly picked him up in a fashion that resembled a hug. "I told you not to move much."

"What do you care?" Axel asked sharply, "What the Hell makes me so important to you? You don't even know anything about me."

Renamon simply hugged him tighter and said, "It's true that I don't know much about you, but I found you, bleeding to death on a riverbank. And that's what I care. Because I can't just stand idly by and watch someone die. Not again."

Axel was tempted to ask what she was talking about, but decided to let it be. Rather, he asked a simple question. "How long are you going to keep hugging me? Seriously. This is kind of awkward."

"To be fair, I'll give you a choice," Renamon said, "You can take a bath now, or we can rest for the night, and you can take a bath in the morning."
112112112.title: At a bit of a loss for words.

choices: Accept that as an offer for a place to live.
1121121121.content:
"Well, since I don't like washing up in the morning, I suppose I'll take a bath now." Axel said, slightly uncomfortable with the fact that Renamon was still hugging him. "But I take my baths alone. So don't even think about joining me, or anything like that."

"Well, that's too bad." Renamon said, moving over to the lakeside. "Because if you're taking a bath, then I have to be with you, just to make certain you don't hurt yourself. Although, if it makes you feel any better, I can alter my size to something closer to yours."

"Not helping at all." Axel muttered through gritted teeth.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------

In the lake, while Axel was mid-torso deep in the water, Renamon came up behind him and asked, "So, how did you get all these scars?"

"A result of my parents bringing their work home." Axel replied flatly. "Every time they actually came home, that is. Which is to say, maybe twice a week, and never for long. And is it too much to ask for a little privacy?"

"So... what are your parents like?" Renamon pressed, intrigued to hear about her guest.

"If they gave any less of a damn about me, they wouldn't even know I existed." Axel said, still emotionless. "Hell, I could run away and they probably wouldn't notice for a decade. The school doesn't require that I attend, I don't have a job anymore, and I've been left for dead. I doubt anyone would come looking for me."

"So you could stay here with me and there'd be no problem?" Renamon asked hopefully.
1121121121.title: Might as well have a bath now.

choices: A few problems with the plan.
11211211211.content:
"I could stay here, yes." Axel said scrubbing his arm around the makeshift splint on it. "But if I'm going to, I'd need to go home to get a few things."

Renamon simply let out a very happy "Yay!" before picking up Axel in a massive bear hug from behind. She may have only been slightly larger than Axel at that point, but she was still strong enough to be able to nearly lift him out of the water.

"You know, this is really awkward for me!" Axel said loudly, flailing slightly in Renamon's grip, trying to get her to let go.

"Hm? Oh, right. Sorry." Renamon said sheepishly, "I forgot that you have some modesty issues. Sorry about that. I just got really excited is all. It can be very lonely here after a while."

"I know the feeling." Axel said, moving towards the shoreline while Renamon played in the water a bit longer. "Anyway, we can head to my house tomorrow. I presume you can find where you found me at?"

"It shouldn't be too hard." Renamon said, moving towards Axel after he got his jeans back on. She hugged him as she reverted back to her original height and continued, "Because when we get there, we just have to follow the river upstream-"

"Until we find a bridge that I will definitely recognize, and from there, I just have to follow the road back to my house." Axel completed her statement. "It's not too much that I'd be retrieving; a few Hawaiian shirts, the few jeans I have that fit me. The little necessities. Perhaps a few blankets and a sleeping bag. Maybe a cot or a hammock. And if I'm lucky, my parents won't have been home to ask questions, assuming they ever paid that much attention to me. But for now, I just need some sleep."

"Agreed." Renamon said. She set Axel down on his back, and very carefully lay down over him, acting as a very large and living blanket.

"I just realized something." Axel said, before closing his eyes, "I don't even know your name."

"I suppose I don't really have one," Renamon said pensively, "I'm not sure why, but I feel like it just fits if you call me Rena. How's that sound?"

"It sounds good." Axel replied. "Good night, Rena."
11211211211.title: Better than nothing

choices: Axel gets through the coversation without much trouble.
Not so easy to convince them of anything.
112112112112.content:
Early next morning, around five a.m., Axel woke up and shifted a little. Something on top of him shivered, as if enjoying that feeling. It took Axel a moment to recall that he wasn't at home. He was staying with a giant Renamon who he could now refer to as Rena, and he was planning on staying with her.

"Could you do that again?" Renamon asked quietly. You know you're too good at reading people when you can hear them blush, Axel thought. He repeated his movements, getting another squirm out of Rena, who simply sighed happily. "Thanks, that felt marvelous." Axel could've sworn he felt a faint purring, but paid it no mind for the moment.

"Shall we go get my stuff?" Axel asked as Rena sat up. "I suspect it might take a while to go through the whole process."

"Away we go." Rena replied, practically beaming.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------

For the most part, the trip was uneventful. Finding the bridge had been simple, and covering the sixteen miles between the bridge and Axel's home had been a breeze. As they approached Axel's house, however, Axel motioned for Rena to stop.

"Rena, I really do appreciate your help," Axel said in a tone that made Rena suspect he didn't want to say it. "But it would be a very bad idea for you to go near my house. If my parents are there, and they see you, they wouldn't rest until they have you in a cage and can run God only knows how many tests on you. So for your own safety, wait to pick me up until i get back here. Please."

"Then I will wait." Rena replied, sitting down in a meditative pose.

"Thanks." Axel said, running off towards his home.

As Axel opened the front door, a voice stopped him dead in his tracks. "Welcome home, Axel."

"Hi, mom." Axel said through gritted teeth. His mother was standing in the kitchen, chopping carrots, as if nothing was the matter, yet Axel still got the unnerving feeling that his parents weren't quite human. The blank, analytical voice made it all the more unsettling.

"And where exactly were you last night?" She inquired, sound as though she didn't really care. "If you were under the impression that you can just vanish and we won't notice, you're sorely mistaken. Your father and I are very upset with you about that."

"I was staying with a friend," Axel replied lamely, "My car was stolen, then I was mugged while walking home, and then, I was thrown off a bridge into a river."

"You really should know better than to try lying to us."

"Dad. You're both home." Axel said with sarcastic enthusiasm.
112112112112.title: A few problems with the plan.

choices: Waits patiently for nightfall. He can sneak out.
1121121121122.content:
"You honestly expect us to believe that you lost the car, were robbed, and thrown off a bridge, and then had to stay with a friend?" Axel's dad asked. He easily had the build of a quarterback, leading few people to believe he actually worked as a scientist, but nobody questioned it when he said so.

"Yeah, I do." Axel said, trying to remain calm. It wasn't easy when nobody believed him. "Also, I was fired. Not kidding. Call my former boss and ask. She'll tell you as much."

"What friend were you staying with?" Axel's mom inquired, moving from carrots to onions.

"What?" Was all Axel could manage in his surprise at the question.

"Who. Did. You. Stay. With." Axel's mother repeated slowly. "Name, address, and phone number."

Axel hesitated trying to think fast to satisfy the questions. "Her name is Rena. I've never really paid attention to her address, and I don't think she has a phone."

"You really are not helping your case." Axel's dad growled off to the side. "Until we meet this girl that you've never mentioned before, you will be confined to your room."

"So resilient. He makes me think of that project we worked on so long ago." Axel's mom said as she heard Axel's door slam shut. "Do you ever wonder what happened to it after it escaped?"

"Not really." Axel's father said flatly. "It probably died not long after it got out. Things like that wouldn't blend into a forest very well, and if it did survive until now, the amount of food it would need would be... well, I'll leave it considerable quantities per meal. Probably."

Meanwhile, Axel...
1121121121122.title: Not so easy to convince them of anything.

choices: Axel gets away on his own.
11211211211221.content:
Axel packed what was available of what he needed in silent haste, filling up two duffel bags with clothes, blankets, and pillows. As he set those down next to his window, he practically fell back onto his bed. I suppose I have to wait for nightfall before I can leave. Axel thought as he lay there, letting his fatigue overrun him. I hope Rena doesn't get impatient easily.

-----------------------------------------------------

With nothing to safely do but sit and wait, Rena, meanwhile, had begun napping, waiting for Axel to enter the clearing any moment, a bag or two packed and ready to leave. It's been over two hours by now. How can he not have gotten what he needed and got away? Rena shifted slightly in discomfort of the idea, recalling the scars on Axel's body. But he said for me to wait here, no matter how long it takes. He could easily have been detained, so he's fine...right?

------------------------------------------------------

"I'm telling you, dear, that boy had a plotting look in his eyes, like he intends to run away." Axel's father said, pacing back and forth. "And this girl he calls Rena, who is she? How long has he known her? And where does she live? We've never heard of her, never even met her, and yet something about what Axel said makes me feel like she's very intimate with him. It's unnerving, knowing that there's something he's managing to hide from us."

"Calm yourself, Jan. I say we let him be." Axel's mother said, placidly tossing together a salad, despite Jan's look of utter shock. "If he's left to his own business, then we can track him. Most likely, back to our mystery girl, in the case of which, we then find some use for her. It's simple enough. We let him go, our questions get answers.
11211211211221.title: Waiting game.

choices: She's too sleepy, and reflexively tries to eat him.
112112112112211.content:
Axel had quickly fallen asleep after he finished packing up and hidden his bags. He slept through the afternoon, waking only to have dinner when it was served. He squirmed a bit in agitation while he continued to wait, impatient to get away from this place he once called home. Eventually, his mother walked in and sat down next to him on his bed.

"Is there anything you want to talk about?" She asked, catching Axel completely off guard. Never before had such interest been expressed towards him that he was aware of, and yet now he was being asked how he was. "I know it's probably not the best feeling in the world, with Jan not believing you about why you're late getting home, but I've noticed that your arm is actually damaged."

"And?" Axel replied, bordering on the same kind of indifference he was so accustomed to receiving.

"Well, this girl, Rena, seems like a good friend if she put that splint on it. But I just can't help but wonder, what's she like?"

"She's tall, blond, athletic, smart, and charming." Axel replied flatly, as if that was the end of the conversation. When did she start caring? Axel wondered as his mother left quietly, apparently expecting no further answers. He shortly resumed napping, continuing his wait for midnight.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
This can't go on for much longer, Rena thought. Something isn't right for how long he's taking. But he told me to wait, even if I don't want to. So he's probably right.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------< br />
Axel slipped his bags over his shoulders as his clock ticked past the twelve. He slowly opened his door, shuffling out before it opened to the point where it squeaked. Within minutes of slow walking, he was finally making a silent dash across the back yard, moving for the treeline, so as to avoid tripping the motion detectors out front. After five minutes of quiet dashing, he was standing in front of Rena as she slept, her breathing calm and slow.

"Rena," Axel whispered, softly rubbing her shoulder. Her eyes snapped open, and she quickly pinned him down before...
112112112112211.title: The Great Escape.

1121121121122112.content:
Rena quickly grew to a phenomenal size with Axel still pinned down under her paw. Before he knew it, Rena's jaws were closing around him, her teeth missing him by inches. Axel tried to remain as still as he could, vainly attempting to convince himself that Rena had a reason for this. He felt a shifting beneath himself, and after being coated in saliva, he was moving closer to the sheer drop of Rena's esophagus. Axel closed his eyes the moment he felt himself moving downward at a slow pace, certain that if he opened them, he would be completely unable to prevent himself from vomiting. It was a few minutes before he felt any change in his surroundings, but the change was very abrupt. Where once he had been relatively tightly enclosed, he now found himself in free-fall, splashing into Rena's stomach. After a few moments, Axel felt a burning sensation on his right arm, in a very centralized fashion, as though only a small area was being digested. He quickly waded over to one of the sides, despite the increasing pain in his arm, and the following pains all over the rest of his body, particularly where he'd been cut and stabbed. Without hesitation, he delivered one sharp punch to the wall of Rena's stomach, which caused her to double over in pain, throwing Axel off his feet.

That's my cue, Rena thought as she went down to her knees.

Axel felt another shift in gravity, followed by a rush of stomach fluids blasting him off his feet and back up Rena's throat. He landed with an audible thump on his back, and quickly scrambled to his feet while Rena merely followed him with her eyes.

"What... the hell... was...that for?" Axel shouted at Rena. She looked apologetically at Axel before silently moving over to him and examining his right arm.

"I thought so..." Rena mused quietly to herself as she noticed a small incision on Axel's forearm. She shifted her size down to just slightly larger than Axel, and quickly ran a claw through the cut, getting a yelp of pain from Axel. He jerked away from her, glaring in such a manner that most people would have cringed in fear.

"You owe me an explanation." Axel said with clear hostility.

"I guessed that your parents, since you suggested that they were very clever, would do something." Rena said, holding up a tiny silvery cylinder. "I think they were planning on following us."
1121121121122112.title: Not what it seems...

11211211211221121.content:
“And you couldn't have asked or warned me before you did that?” Axel spat out with slight vehemence. His harsher edge of anger had subsided with his understanding of reason, but that didn't stop the general agitation at what had transpired.

“You said yourself that your parents are cunning, so I simply did something that I felt was well within precautionary measures.” Rena said, shrugging, “Would you rather that they’d followed us and found me?”

“…No…” Axel said hesitantly. Rena was trouncing him with logic, and he had no defense to it.

“And if I had asked or warned you of what I was about to do, would you have agreed to do so, or at least not have fought back as much as you did?” Axel didn't need his eyes to detect the smug little smile on Rena’s face.

Axel was at a loss for words. He could have said as much about the immorality of it as he wanted, but he had no real argument against the pragmatic soundness of Rena’s idea. “Sorry, I would've just appreciated it more if I had known that you weren't about to kill me. That is, to say, I don’t suppose I mind the action itself as much as that little primal fear of being eaten alive, uncertain whether or not I’m going to live to see tomorrow. Warn me next if there’s a ‘next time’.”

Rena simply smiled and, after reverting to her massive size, picked up Axel's bags in one hand, and Axel in the other.

1121321.content:
It was late at night by the time you're shift ended and you were walking down the street, the only reason you came in was overtime for this company meant triple pay. Suddenly you freeze, you swear you could feel yourself being watched, but you couldn't tell from where, or by what. You slowly started walking faster then before but you tried to act casual, you make it to the the streetlamp at the edge of your street when you felt something pass you. You tried to retaliate punching at whatever it was, you connected but whatever it was just laughs and you felt something cover your whole face and you fainted from lack of oxygen.

You slowly awoke from unconsciousness, it was weird, you were laying on something furry, and soft, like a big soft carpet. You heard a female voice gently humming, you slowly moved and then froze as a hand or what you could only assume was a hand as big as your body covered you. It gently petted you and you started to feel sleepy and you heard the same humming voice say "that's it, just go back to sleep." You resisted the urge to go to sleep however and the voice seems to have an epihpany "I know warm milk" it says. You heard rummaging and soon a cup filled with milk was at your lips, you slowly drank and she was right, you near instantly fell asleep, you heard a giggle but it was weird it sounded like....a cat's meow. You woke up slowly, you were still on the large carpet you were on before and you heard breathing. You slowly got up and looked around, it was weird, it looked like you were in some sort of building namely a kitchen with wood floors, but everything was huge, and I mean huge, everything had to be made for something 200ft tall.

You started moving around and you swear you heard purring, the carpet you were on was weird. It led up and down but barely side to side and up led to 2 large hills, you walked across the carpet and froze as you looked through the gap created by the hills. You were looking down at a face, somewhat human but it had cat ears on the top of it's head instead of normal ones, a small black nose, a small mischievious smile on it's mouth, it was covered in fur and when she blinked you saw it had big blue curious eyes. You slowly stepped back but you stepped in the wrong spot as you heard the creature give off an audible moan and the eyes opened. It quickly sat up and looked down at you, you were picked up in between 2 claws at and you finally got a good look at whatever had kidnapped you. She wasn't human, that much was evident not only due to size but the fact she was covered in white fur, it was also evident whatever she was, she was a feline. There were purple strips on her tail as well as a tiny bell and ribbon more suited to a normal sized cat. She had long powerful legs, those of a hunter and they ended in paws not feet. Her body was very athletic so she was slim and well-built but she wasn't covered in muscle. Her arms were long and slender and ended in hands covered in fur and pads and her chest was huge, probably d-cups as they sagged a bit as whatever this thing was it was not wearing clothes which made you turn away as her nether regions were in full view. You felt yourself lifted up and the purring increases "so your finally up" she says.

"Y...you can talk" you say looking at her eye to body.

"Of course I can talk" she replies. You were silent for a few minutes as you really couldn't think of anything to say, okay you could but "please don't eat me" didn't seem right at this moment. The creature seems to grow impatient and pokes you, "geez I finally find you after all this time, and you forget about me" she says poutily.

"What? I think i'd remember something like you if I met you" you say. She looked hurt, more because you said you, then anything else.

"You really don't remember?" she says. She puts you down, lays out on the floor and starts rolling from side to side mewing, as you don't seem to get it she gets up, walks over to a fridge as big or bigger then most high-rises and pulls out a fish. She puts the fish in her mouth and repeats the action and you were left dumbfounded. "That..that can't be, you're Sally, that stray I fed" you say backing up as she quickly eats the fish.

"Bingo" Sally says looking at you, "you'd be suprised what some government experiments can do to a kitten" she continues. You just stared up at her, 2 years ago you had fed this cat everyday and even made a little house for her out of a blanket, a box, and an umbrella for when it rained, but one day, a year ago, she had just disappeared. You looked for her for a week straight but there was no sign of her. You stared up at her and she smiled "well aren't you gonna say something?" she says.

"You're...bigger, then I remember, and how are you standing on 2 legs?" you say.

"Yeah the government wanted a bio weapon, so they made me this big, they made me human like to reduce fear" she says. "Thankfully the project's been discontinued and well now that the government doesn't want the news about me getting out, they made me this house and I get free everything, tv, food, water, it's pretty sweet" she says.

"Why do you look like that gatomon character from digimon?" you ask.

"Oh, one of the researchers was a fan, and he insisted that everyone would be able to identify me better if I looked similar yet distinct, thus no ring, and no purple except on the tail, also no gloves" she says. You look back over at her tail and you start walking towards it and she lowers it, you look at the bell and pink ribbon again, it was the same one. The one you had given Sally and she had worn proudly from that day on. "I never forgot you" she says, "you actually kept me going through all the experiments and other testing" she says. You turned and stared at her you're eyes misting, "i'm sorry, I couldn't find you, I looked and looked but still..." you trail off as tears start to fall. You run up and hug her side "Sally I missed you so much" you say burying you're face in her fur, you were sure she was smiling as you felt her furry hand wrap around you and she picks you up and hugs you. "I missed you too Alex" she replies. You hugged you're kitten, excuse me, cat's cheek and she rubbed against you, "geez you don't even have my scent on you anymore" she says. You laughed as she playfully rubbed against you when a realization hit you, "wait Sally were you the one who kidnapped me?" you ask.

"Well....maybe" she says her tail flicking from side to side.

"What about my family, it's been hours, I should have been home" you say. Sally nods "don't worry, the government took care of that, you are now working for them in a high paying job that placed you overseas. As for why you never came home, you're presence at your new job was needed immediatley and you were flown out." she says.

"So...what's my job?" you ask.

"Well the technical name is supervisor of biological studies and natural warfare." she says.

"Plain english please" you reply.

"My caretaker" she says happily.

"So...i'm going to watch over you till we die?" you ask.

"Yep, although don't worry we will get out of here, they said if everything goes well I can be revealed in 20 or 30 years, give or take a few" Sally says. You nod, it wasn't the best circumstance, but you were reunited with you're cat. You think to yourself and decide to try something "lay down on your stomach" you say, she puts you down and lays down. You climb onto her head and start scratching behind her ears and instantly she starts purring up a storm, you stop for a second and then start again and you were just able to reach under her chin. It was like you were standing next to a jet engine the purring was so loud and you knew this was your Sally.
